Dear Mr. Akers:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A few months ago, staff member cussed at a youth and said,
“stupid ass bitch, you don’t cuss at me” after youth cussed at him.
Another youth heard this happen. There was also another
unknown female staff around who heard it. A few months ago,
same staff went to youth’s bedroom and tickled her feet while she
was sleeping. Another youth saw this happen and told an
unknown 3rd shift staff member about it. That 3rd shift staff
member no longer works at the facility.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
The Complainant is this Consultant. This information was
disclosed by Youth A during an interview regarding a separate
investigation.
Youth A was interviewed via phone on 2/15/24. Youth A
reported Staff 1 cussed at Youth B by saying “stupid ass bitch,
you don’t cuss at me” after Youth B cussed at Staff 1. Youth A
reported it happened a few months ago and she was present
during the exchange and heard it. Youth A reported another day a
few months ago, Staff 1 went to Youth B’s bedroom while she was
sleeping and tickled Youth B’s feet. Youth A reported she was
standing in the hallway outside of the bedroom, saw it happen and
told Staff 1 to “get out of there, that’s not right”. Youth A reported
Youth B woke up when it happened. Youth A reported Youth B
told Staff 4 about the incident today but isn’t sure if Youth B ever
told anyone prior to today. Youth A reported she told a third shift
staff member about the incident when it happened but was unable
to provide a name or description of the staff member other than it
was someone who no longer worked at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/20/24.
Youth B reported a few months ago, she and Staff 1 were talking
about something, and she got mad about something Staff 1 said,
so she told him to “shut up”. Youth B reported Staff 1 replied “don’t
2

fucking tell me to shut up” in a loud tone. Youth B reported she
could tell Staff 1 was angry because he was tense, and his fists
were balled up. Youth B reported after the exchange, they walked
away from each other and “it wasn’t a big deal”. Youth B reported
Staff 2 was present during the exchange and she thinks Staff 2
heard what happened. Youth B reported a couple days after the
exchange, she met with Therapist/Chief Administrator (CA) and
told him Staff 1 was frustrated with her and cussed at her. Youth B
reported Therapist/CA told her he would have a talk with Staff 1
about it. Youth B reported she hadn’t had any issues with Staff 1
prior to or after that incident. Youth B reported she has never
heard him cuss at anyone else, and she thinks he was just
frustrated at the time. Youth B reported she doesn’t know about a
time when he came in and tickled her feet when she was sleeping.
Youth B reported she doesn’t know why anyone would say
something like that and doesn’t believe anything like that
happened.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/20/24.
Staff 1 reported more than a month ago, but not sure exactly
when, he and Youth B had a disagreement. Staff 1 reported Youth
B woke up one morning and asked for two cereals and two brown
sugars. Staff 1 reported he is a stickler for youth having too much
processed sugar because a youth he previously worked with at
another job developed diabetes while in placement. Staff 1
reported the cereal Youth B was requesting already had sugar in
it, so he felt two brown sugar packets was too much and declined
Youth B’s request. Youth B said she was allowed to if she wanted
it. Staff 1 informed her they have rules about portions and food
they provide, and mentioned all the excess sugar could cause
diabetes. Staff 1 reported Youth B was very upset with his
response and started “going off”. Staff 1 reported he responded by
burying his head in his hands and said, “your fucking pancreas is
going to die”. Staff 1 told Youth B the reason he said no to her
was for a medical reason, not a personal reason. Youth B told
Staff 1 to shut up because he was pissing her off. Staff 1 reported
he said “don’t talk to me like that. I’m not your slave. I’m a human
being and you don’t need to treat me like that” and walked away
from the table. Staff 1 reported he was attempting to set a very
firm boundary with her by being stern, but afterwards he felt she
probably thought he was yelling at her, even though he wasn’t
yelling. Staff 1 reported he felt bad afterwards because he doesn’t
want to leave a negative effect on the youth he's working with.
Staff 1 reported after the exchange, there was some tension
between them. Staff 1 reported looking back on it, he wishes he
would have stood up from the table, told her they could talk about
3

it another time, and walked away. Staff 1 reported he feels it
became more of a problem because other staff would probably
give her two sugars, so youth have a hard time adapting to those
inconsistencies. Staff 1 reported he later apologized to Youth B for
any additional stress he caused her during their exchange. He
reported he never called Youth B a “stupid ass bitch” and never
said “don’t fucking tell me to shut up”. Staff 1 reported there has
never been a time when he’s tickled Youth B’s feet while she was
in her room sleeping. Staff 1 reported the only time he would ever
tickle a youth’s feet would be if he has a good relationship with
them, if they were in the milieu, and they welcomed it. Staff 1
reported he’s very cautious about the physical touch he utilizes
with youth.
Therapist/CA was interviewed face to face at the facility on
2/20/24. Therapist/CA reported one time in therapy, Youth B
stated Staff 1 made her feel uncomfortable, but also said he was a
good staff member. Therapist/CA asked Youth B why Staff 1
made her feel uncomfortable, and Youth B replied, “I don’t know,
he just does”. Therapist/CA reported subsequently, he made the
decision to move Staff 1 to a different pod since Youth B stated
Staff 1 made her uncomfortable. Therapist/CA reported he has
never received any reports or concerns of Staff 1 cussing at, or
tickling Youth B. Therapist/CA reported Youth B stated Staff 1 was
sterner with her more than normal one time, but she never stated
Staff 1 cussed at her.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 2/21/24. Staff 2 reported
in the last couple of months, there was a time she was sitting at a
table with Youth B and Staff 1, and they were having a verbal
confrontation with each other. Staff 2 reported Youth B was very
upset and told Staff 1 to shut up. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
responded by saying “Don’t treat me like I’m a slave” and “Don’t
talk to me like that”. Staff 2 reported Youth B and Staff 1 were
both upset and after the exchange, Staff 1 walked away. Staff 2
reported she did not hear Staff 1 cuss at Youth B at any point
during the conversation. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was not yelling
but was direct during the conversation. Staff 2 reported she feels
Staff 1 should have handled the situation differently because
weight can be a trigger for youth, and him mentioning diabetes
can make a youth think he is talking about the youth’s weight.
Staff 2 also felt Staff 1 saying “don’t treat me like a slave” was
inappropriate for multiple reasons.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 2/21/24. Staff 3 was a
third shift staff member who no longer works at the facility. Staff 3
4

reported she has never heard of Staff 1 tickling Youth B’s feet
while she was sleeping in her room, and Staff 3 never witnessed
anything regarding that either.
Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 2/21/24. Staff 4 reported
Youth B has never reported an incident to her about Staff 1
tickling her feet while she was sleeping. Staff 4 reported last week
Youth B told her Staff 1 made her feel uncomfortable and she
didn’t like him but wouldn’t go into detail as to why she felt that
way.
An attempt was made to interview Staff 5 via phone on
2/21/24, but the only phone number the facility had for her
was a non-working phone number. Staff 5 was a third shift staff
member who no longer works at the facility.
Staff 6 was interviewed via phone on 2/21/24. Staff 6 was a
third shift staff member who no longer works at the facility. Staff 6
reported she does not know who Staff 1 is. Staff 6 reported she
has never heard of Staff 1 tickling Youth B’s feet while she was
sleeping in her room, and Staff 6 never witnessed anything
regarding that either.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services Recipient
Rights C-1 Policy states the program actively promotes the
safeguarding of recipient rights and respect for recipient’s
cultural, psychosocial, and spiritual values within the
treatment environment. Keeping the concept of providing
mental health services to recipients in an atmosphere of
compassion, concern, and respect. Recipients should be
able to voice their complaints and disagreements freely
without fear of retaliation.
• Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services Lotus Program
Resident Discipline Policy states verbal abuse including the
use of derogatory or discriminatory language, yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation is prohibited.
• Staff 1 does not have does not have any disciplinary
records in his employee file. Staff 1 completed New
Employee Orientation (which trained facility policies) on
10/2/23, Res. Role of Direct Care training on 10/5/23, QBS-
New Hire Session 1 training on 10/4/23, QBS-Recert
training on 10/4/23, QBS-New Hire Session 2 training on
10/20/23.
5

Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed,
there is no violation established. Although Staff 1 admitted to
using a cuss word, there is no evidence to support Staff 1 cussed
at Youth B in a derogatory or demeaning way, as referenced in
the rule. There is no evidence to support Staff 1 tickled Youth B’s
feet while she was sleeping.
CONSULTATION:
- Staff are not experts in all fields based on their own
personal experiences. If there are concerns with potential
medical issues, mental health issues, etc., they need to rely
on professionals and experts in those fields to explore
those topics with youth. In this situation, if there was a
concern for potential diabetes, Staff 1 should have
contacted nursing or a nutritionist to ask for further direction
and/or have these individuals speak to Youth B.
- Staff should be cautious about the physical touch they
utilize with youth, even if the relationship between them is
good and youth welcome it.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(a) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Rule Violation
Type
Allegation Staff was unprofessional in interactions with youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/20/24.
During the incident in question, Staff 1 reported he responded by
burying his head in his hands and said, “your fucking pancreas is
going to die” towards Youth B. Staff 1 told Youth B the reason he
said no to her was for a medical reason, not a personal reason.
Youth B told Staff 1 to shut up and Staff 1 reported he said “don’t
talk to me like that. I’m not your slave. I’m a human being and you
don’t need to treat me like that” and walked away from the table.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 2/21/24. During the
incident in question, Staff 2 reported Staff 1 responded to Youth B
by saying “Don’t treat me like I’m a slave” and “Don’t talk to me
like that”. Staff 2 felt Staff 1 saying “don’t treat me like a slave”
was inappropriate for multiple reasons.
6

During interviews with both Youth A and Youth B they
indicated Staff 1 cursed at the youth.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Pine Rest Christian Mental Health Services Standards for
Staff-Client Relationships Policy states staff members have
the obligation to be appropriate role models for persons
served, and other staff members. Staff members shall
serve the best interests of the person served by providing
quality professional services.
• Staff 1 does not have does not have any disciplinary
records in his employee file. Staff 1 completed New
Employee Orientation (which trained facility policies) on
10/2/23.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentation reviewed, this
violation is established. Staff need to ensure they are having
appropriate conversations and utilizing appropriate
words/terminology with youth. Cussing in a conversation with a
youth is not appropriate, even during times of frustration. In
addition, phrasing such as “don’t treat me like a slave” is
inappropriate.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024C0000969 dated 1/10/24; CAP approved 1/22/24
SIR2024C0000996 dated 1/24/24; CAP approved 2/6/24
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
